SKS Sporter - 16" D-handle stock (thumbhole), stamped sporter on receiver, neutered bayonet lug. Similar to SKS-M

Type 84 - 16" standard stock, normal markings on receiver, folding bayonet, bolt hold open button located on bolt carrier, AK mag tangs must be modified to fit

SKS -NR - 16" D-handle stock, stamped NR on receiver, neutered bayonet lug

They used a frame mounted firing pin with a transfer bar safety. Fully adjustable rear sight with high blade front sight and wood grips with S&W logo. Barrel as I would measure it, from muzzle to forcing cone/cylinder face, is about 3.5 inches. I am including the pictured leather Hunter holster. It has seen a good deal of holster use, judging by condition I would say it has seen more holster use than actual shooting use. Timing is perfect, never shaves lead or has any slop in the hammer and trigger draw. Lock up is tight with very little side to side play. End play is similar, the forcing cone to cylinder gap with cylinder pulled fully aft is .002" The trigger breaks crisp at 3 pounds on a snap cap every time. There is some apparent wear to the passivation, particularly on the cylinder, but some at high points on the barrel and frame as well. There is some rotation ring on the cylinder, and a little evidence of flash cutting on the top strap, but no more than would be expected of a pistol this old that has been used. Chambers and bore are clean without any evidence of corrosion, crown is in perfect shape. Grips are solid without cracks or structural damage, checkering is sharp with little damage. The grips appear to be original with the last three digits of the serial number stamped on the inside of one side. Frame stamps and crane stamp also match. All in all I have seen guns in better condition, but I have seen far worse. This gun is functionally excellent, and would make a great shooter or collectable piece of S&W history from their golden days.
